answers.answer: Might be a stomach condition caused by diabetes, so get checked for diabetes if you haven't.  Get checked for celiac disease.  If your weight is too low, mirtazapine might help calm your stomach and let you eat.  It's a very useful drug that I took to help me put on weight when my gallbladder went south.Stomach problems can be tricky to diagnose, and if you let it go without finding the cause, nothing will happen to track down the cause.Hope you feel better soon.

question: I was ill, violently vomiting, about 3 months ago, and recently this feeling of gagging and nausea has occured. I am 14, healthy etc and have been to the doctor who prescribed ranitidine as he thought it was stomach acid, which has stopped the nausea but the feeling in my throat is still carrying on. He sent me for an ultrasound to check there is nothing in my stomach, but it came back clear, as did blood tests. I am to finish the course of ranitidine but I don't think anyone is bothered as nothing showed up on any of my tests. Mine is very bad in the morning, about 1-2 hours after I get up, and then generally subsides to a steady feeling for the rest of the day. I honestly don't know what's wrong with me, kind of scared :/
title: GAGGING FEELING AND NAUSEA constantly!
